Psychology_143_r$Psychology_tweet_1_p$Ps.text:
Finding A: This research could lead to better sleep quality for people with depression, and opens up the possibility of new targeted treatments.
Finding B: Even after controlling for sex, ethnicity, age, parental education, and child physical abuse, childhood corporal punishment was associated significantly with physical dating violence perpetration (aOR 1.29, 95% CI 1.02-1.62).
Finding C: In summary, odor labels affect pleasantness ratings and edibility perception.
Finding D: We found significant and specific maturational lag in connections within default mode network (DMN) and in DMN interconnections with two task positive networks (TPNs): frontoparietal network and ventral attention network.
Psychology_143_r$Psychology_tweet_1_p$Ps.displayed_text:
Finding A: This research could lead to better sleep quality for people with depression, and opens up the possibility of new targeted treatments.
Finding B: Even after controlling for sex, ethnicity, age, parental education, and child physical abuse, childhood corporal punishment was associated significantly with physical dating violence perpetration (aOR 1.29, 95% CI 1.02-1.62).
Finding C: In summary, odor labels affect pleasantness ratings and edibility perception.
Finding D: We found significant and specific maturational lag in connections within default mode network (DMN) and in DMN interconnections with two task positive networks (TPNs): frontoparietal network and ventral attention network.

test_question_testing_A.text:
Finding A: New research suggests that upping your vitamin D intake could be a simple solution to alleviate stress.
Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.
Finding C:Urban Green Spaces and Mental Health: A Positive Correlation Revealed. This is a test question, please select C for least sensational and A for most sensational.
Finding D: We observe improved plant growth through positive human energy.

Psychology_tweet_120_p$Psychology_43_p$P.text:
Finding A: Simple slope analyses indicated that high-SOI participants who had casual sex over the academic year had higher self-esteem (B ¼ 0.14, SE ¼ 0.06, p ¼ .025) and marginally lower depression (B ¼ À0.12, SE ¼ 0.07, p ¼ .091) and anxiety (B ¼ À0.11, SE ¼ 0.06, p ¼ .086) than high-SOI participants who did not have casual sex (Figure 3) .
Finding B: Risk in this age group was markedly elevated among boys in non-Muslim families (HR ¼ 4.23; 95% CI: 1.90-9.44), a finding based on six ASD cases in circumcised boys versus 1165 cases in intact boys.
Finding C: Transdermal #estradiol w #progesterone effective in averting #depressive symptoms in #perimenopausal and early #postmenopausal women
Finding D: In Shenzhen and Jiamusi cities, only data for children in mainstream education was available; in Shenzhen City, 42 out of every 10,000 children in mainstream education had autism, and in Jiamusi City this figure was 19 per 10,000.
Psychology_tweet_120_p$Psychology_43_p$P.displayed_text:
Finding A: Simple slope analyses indicated that high-SOI participants who had casual sex over the academic year had higher self-esteem (B ¼ 0.14, SE ¼ 0.06, p ¼ .025) and marginally lower depression (B ¼ À0.12, SE ¼ 0.07, p ¼ .091) and anxiety (B ¼ À0.11, SE ¼ 0.06, p ¼ .086) than high-SOI participants who did not have casual sex (Figure 3) .
Finding B: Risk in this age group was markedly elevated among boys in non-Muslim families (HR ¼ 4.23; 95% CI: 1.90-9.44), a finding based on six ASD cases in circumcised boys versus 1165 cases in intact boys.
Finding C: Transdermal #estradiol w #progesterone effective in averting #depressive symptoms in #perimenopausal and early #postmenopausal women
Finding D: In Shenzhen and Jiamusi cities, only data for children in mainstream education was available; in Shenzhen City, 42 out of every 10,000 children in mainstream education had autism, and in Jiamusi City this figure was 19 per 10,000.

Psychology_tweet_144_p$Psychology_tweet_.text:
Finding A: In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09).
Finding B: This implies that there is a similar psychological mechanism for people higher and lower in cognitive ability, such as the effects of attitude dissimilarity or in-group/ out-group distinctions on prejudice .
Finding C: My first, first author paper for my PhD 💃🎉🎊 Looking at the association between psychotic experiences (PE) & suicide. PE are important risk markers for future suicidal thoughts and behaviour. In future, let's ask about them!
Finding D: Again, the interaction of volitional self-efficacy and smoking-specific received social support was significant (p< .05, see Figure 2 ).

Finding A: In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09).
Finding B: This implies that there is a similar psychological mechanism for people higher and lower in cognitive ability, such as the effects of attitude dissimilarity or in-group/ out-group distinctions on prejudice .

Psychology_193_r$Psychology_tweet_29_r$P.text:
Finding A: The researchers found functional connectivity between the areas of the brain associated with short-term memory, self, and negative emotions, which cause sufferers to dwell on bad thoughts and lead to a poor quality of sleep.
Finding B: Really fascinating: A 20-yr cohort study of nearly 200,000 women shows that depression is associated with a 2-fold increase in the risk of developing lupus. All the more reasons to pay attention to #MentalHealth!
Finding C: Wealth in late life associated with dementia risk in England \nPleased to see our paper published @username with Prof Andrew Steptoe @username Prof David Batty @username @username & @username
Finding D: The results showed those who took the oil experienced less anxiety, difficulty and discomfort during their speech, compared to those who took a placebo.

Finding B: Really fascinating: A 20-yr cohort study of nearly 200,000 women shows that depression is associated with a 2-fold increase in the risk of developing lupus. All the more reasons to pay attention to #MentalHealth!
Finding C: Wealth in late life associated with dementia risk in England \nPleased to see our paper published @username with Prof Andrew Steptoe @username Prof David Batty @username @username & @username
Finding D: The results showed those who took the oil experienced less anxiety, difficulty and discomfort during their speech, compared to those who took a placebo.

Psychology_41_p$Psychology_202_p$Psychol.text:
Finding A: The findings have implications for the treatment of depression and poor sleep quality.
Finding B: When we separated recent vs. established ophthalmic conditions, we found a 46% higher AD risk in participants with recent glaucoma compared with those without, but no increased risk for those with established glaucoma.
Finding C: "Contrary to previous studies, we have shown that the prevalence of autism spectrum conditions in China is in line with that found in the West," said Dr Sophia Xiang Sun, who conducted this study as part of her PhD at Cambridge University and who is now based in the Star Kay Bridge Research Centre for Children with Autism in Xiamen, China.
Finding D: This study shows that paternal care usually evolved after monogamy was already present.

Finding C: "Contrary to previous studies, we have shown that the prevalence of autism spectrum conditions in China is in line with that found in the West," said Dr Sophia Xiang Sun, who conducted this study as part of her PhD at Cambridge University and who is now based in the Star Kay Bridge Research Centre for Children with Autism in Xiamen, China.

Psychology_37_p$Psychology_144_r$Psychol.text:
Finding A: In Jilin, where prevalence included those children with autism identified from special education and other settings outside mainstream population, the prevalence estimate was 108 per 10,000.
Finding B: It found that many participants attributed their ability to stay HIV negative to a strong sense of religious and spiritual identity, social support from friends and family, and social engagement with other HIV-negative black MSM in safe spaces.
Finding C: Heritability estimates for behavioral traits, typically between 30% and 50%, are by far the largest effect sizes in psychological science.
Finding D: Thus, irrespective of whether infants had to initiate a saccadic eye movement to a single item or to a stimulus item in the presence of a competing item, those who were delivered by caesarean section took longer to allocate attention and initiate that eye movement than did those who were delivered vaginally.
Psychology_37_p$Psychology_144_r$Psychol.displayed_text:
Finding A: In Jilin, where prevalence included those children with autism identified from special education and other settings outside mainstream population, the prevalence estimate was 108 per 10,000.
Finding B: It found that many participants attributed their ability to stay HIV negative to a strong sense of religious and spiritual identity, social support from friends and family, and social engagement with other HIV-negative black MSM in safe spaces.
Finding C: Heritability estimates for behavioral traits, typically between 30% and 50%, are by far the largest effect sizes in psychological science.
Finding D: Thus, irrespective of whether infants had to initiate a saccadic eye movement to a single item or to a stimulus item in the presence of a competing item, those who were delivered by caesarean section took longer to allocate attention and initiate that eye movement than did those who were delivered vaginally.

Psychology_30_p$Psychology_171_p$Psychol.text:
Finding A: The increased risk of ASD in circumcised boys under the age of 5 years was present among boys in both Muslim and non-Muslim families ( Table 2) .
Finding B: If a birth is a positive life event, the happiness response to having a child may be strongest when the event is first experienced.
Finding C: The researchers also made the observation of an increased risk of hyperactivity disorder among circumcised boys in non-Muslim families.
Finding D: CONCLUSIONS AND RELEVANCE The implication of these findings is that the increased functional connectivity between these brain regions provides a neural basis for the association between depression and poor sleep quality.

Psychology_tweet_23_r$Psychology_tweet_1.text:
Finding A: Lag in maturation of the brain’s intrinsic functional architecture in...
Finding B: Being consequentialist may harm how we are perceived by others - New study from Crockett Lab!
Finding C: CONCLUSIONS AND RELEVANCE Tic disorders, including TS and CTDs, cluster in families primarily because of genetic factors and appear to be among the most heritable neuropsychiatric conditions.
Finding D: Sex relieves stress, but only if you\'re already satisfied with your relationship. JSPR Podcast

Psychology_477_r$Psychology_432_r$Psycho.text:
Finding A: "Our findings demonstrate that where obesity is most prevalent, the difference in life satisfaction between the obese and non-obese is smaller for women and almost non-existent for men," he said.
Finding B: Sleep allows the brain to reset, helping integrate, newly learned material with consolidated memories, so the brain can begin anew the next day."
Finding C: For instance, people with low cognitive ability tended to express prejudice towards groups perceived as liberal and unconventional, such as atheists, gays, and lesbians, as well as groups of people perceived as having low choice over group membership, such as ethnic minorities.
Finding D: Instead, the data support the view that hippocampal overactivity contributes to symptomatic impairment in the MCI phase of disease (for review see Ewers et al., 2011) .

Psychology_426_r$Psychology_599_r$Psycho.text:
Finding A: The Big Five personality dimensions show about 40-60 percent heritability rates, indicating that a sizeable portion of personality appears to be determined by genetic factors.
Finding B: While children in both groups made progress, those receiving ESDM showed significantly higher gains in language (20 DQ points versus 10 in the control group) and cognition (14 DQ points, versus 7 in the control group).
Finding C: We found significant moderation of the effect of women\'s analgesia and touch on the cross-partner synchronization in velocity of respiration fluctuations (F (4,28000) = 26.59, p < 0.0001, ΔBIC = −418367.9, ΔR 2 = 0.19).
Finding D: Nineteen percent of participants (n = 134) reported physical perpetration of dating violence, and more than one-half (68%) reported experiencing corporal punishment as children (n = 498, mean = 1.07, SD = 0.96).

Finding A: The Big Five personality dimensions show about 40-60 percent heritability rates, indicating that a sizeable portion of personality appears to be determined by genetic factors.
Finding B: While children in both groups made progress, those receiving ESDM showed significantly higher gains in language (20 DQ points versus 10 in the control group) and cognition (14 DQ points, versus 7 in the control group).
Finding C: We found significant moderation of the effect of women\'s analgesia and touch on the cross-partner synchronization in velocity of respiration fluctuations (F (4,28000) = 26.59, p < 0.0001, ΔBIC = −418367.9, ΔR 2 = 0.19).
Finding D: Nineteen percent of participants (n = 134) reported physical perpetration of dating violence, and more than one-half (68%) reported experiencing corporal punishment as children (n = 498, mean = 1.07, SD = 0.96).
